Kitemark.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a mark in the shape of a kite, which is officially put on goods in Britain to show that their quality is of a good standard
Kitemark.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a special triangular label, used in Britain to show that a product has been tested and approved by the British Standards Institution
Kitemark.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Approved child restraints must carry the BSI Kitemark.
